title: How to Avoid Getting Stung by Jellyfish

steps.title: Avoid areas populated by jellyfish.
steps.content: Avoid areas populated by jellyfish. If at all possible, do not swim or spend time on the shore in areas known to be frequented by jellyfish. Choosing a lower-risk area is the easiest way to reduce your chances of being stung by a jellyfish. You can ask lifeguards, beach officials, or local residents if you are unsure whether or not jellyfish are a danger in a given area. [1] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source [2] X Research source Learn what kinds, if any, are common, and how to treat stings.

steps.title: Recognize risky conditions.
steps.content: Recognize risky conditions. Jellyfish may range near shore when there are strong winds. [3] X Research source They can also appear in large numbers (known as a jellyfish blooms), so avoid the water when these occur. [4] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: Heed warning signs.
steps.content: Heed warning signs. [5] X Trustworthy Source National Health Service (UK) Public healthcare system of the UK Go to source If you see a sign warning of jellyfish, it means that they have been spotted by officials. In areas were jellyfish are known to be a common threat, you may see permanent signs. Swim with caution in these areas, if at all.

steps.title: Watch for purple flags.
steps.content: Watch for purple flags. At many beaches, officials will fly purple flags during times that jellyfish or other dangerous marine animals are present. [6] X Research source If you see these flags flying, this is a signal to stay out of the water to avoid getting stung.

steps.title: Wear shoes when walking on the beach.
steps.content: Wear shoes when walking on the beach. [7] X Research source [8] X Trustworthy Source National Health Service (UK) Public healthcare system of the UK Go to source Jellyfish and stray jellyfish tentacles can be very hard to see, and can remain venomous for a long time, even when washed ashore. By wearing rubber-soled shoes when you walk on the beach, you will avoid accidentally stepping on them with your bare skin and getting stung. [9] X Trustworthy Source National Health Service (UK) Public healthcare system of the UK Go to source

steps.title: Wear protective lotions.
steps.content: Wear protective lotions. Some evidence shows that protective lotions such as Safe Sea may protect against jellyfish stings. Applying one of these lotions before you go in the water can be a good additional precaution. [10] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Look for protective lotions at pharmacies, and shops that sell diving and beach gear.

steps.title: Wear a wetsuit.
steps.content: Wear a wetsuit. [11] X Research source If you will be spending a lot of time in the water, or in deep waters, consider wearing more extensive coverage. [12] X Trustworthy Source National Health Service (UK) Public healthcare system of the UK Go to source The thick material of a wetsuit, and the fact that it will cover a large amount of your skin, makes it an effective deterrent to jellyfish stings. [13] X Research source [14] X Trustworthy Source National Health Service (UK) Public healthcare system of the UK Go to source Clothing coated in petroleum jelly or similar substances is not a reliable protection against jellyfish stings. Some stores that sell diving equipment also carry special “stinger suits” that you can wear to prevent being stung by a jellyfish. [15] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Even if you wear a wetsuit, you should still practice caution and avoid jellyfish, as stings through wetsuits have been reported. [16] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Family Physicians Organization devoted to improving the health of patients, families, and communities Go to source

steps.title: Do not touch jellyfish that have washed ashore.
steps.content: Do not touch jellyfish that have washed ashore. Even if the jellyfish is dead, its poisonous cells can still cause a sting. Some varieties have very long tentacles (such as the Portuguese Man-of-War, that has tentacles up to fifty feet long), so it is best to stay far away from jellyfish. [17] X Trustworthy Source National Health Service (UK) Public healthcare system of the UK Go to source There are many different kinds and forms of jellyfish, and when they are washed ashore they may look like plastic bags or other debris. If you are not sure whether or not something is a jellyfish, it is best not to touch it at all. Tell a lifeguard or other beach authority when you spot a jellyfish on the shore, so that it can be safely removed by someone trained to handle the creature.

steps.title: Swim near a lifeguard.
steps.content: Swim near a lifeguard. [18] X Trustworthy Source National Health Service (UK) Public healthcare system of the UK Go to source Lifeguards are trained to help beachgoers in a variety of situations, including jellyfish attacks. They will also be able to alert you when jellyfish are spotted.

steps.title: Drive jellyfish away.
steps.content: Drive jellyfish away. If you shuffle your feet when walking in shallow water, you may disturb and drive away some jellyfish or other creatures that have the potential to sting you. [19] X Trustworthy Source National Health Service (UK) Public healthcare system of the UK Go to source [20] X Research source

steps.title: Leave the water immediately if you see or suspect a jellyfish.
steps.content: Leave the water immediately if you see or suspect a jellyfish. Often, you can see jellyfish in the water. They may look like a plastic bag or balloon floating at the surface of the water, and may come in groups. [21] X Research source If you see a jellyfish in the water, calmly but quickly return to shore to avoid stings. Tell a lifeguard or other beach authority when you spot a jellyfish in the water, so that a warning can be issued.
